COM.sootNsmoke.prolog
Class PrologCompiler

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--COM.sootNsmoke.prolog.PrologCompiler
public class PrologCompiler
extends java.lang.Object
implements RuntimeConstants

Compiles Prolog files. List the names of the Prolog source files on the command line. This will generate various class files to the current directory. These files are used with the Prolog interpreter in the class COM.sootNsmoke.prolog.Prolog. It will expect the generated files to be somewhere in the CLASSPATH.

Use the "-debug" command line prompt to get debugging information.

Note that this is a trivial Prolog interpreter; do not expect great things of it.

compileTerm

public Sequence compileTerm(java.lang.Object o,
                            java.util.Hashtable bindings,
                            Sequence cont,
                            java.lang.String classname,
                            int currentState,
                            JavaClass cf)
Compile the term o into a sequence of instructions which evaluates it. The arguments mean: o: the code to compile bindings: a hashtable of Variable -> Sequence, which given a variable returns the code to load it. cont: code to do if this term succeeds. classname: the name of the class in which this code is generated currentState: the current state. (Duh.) o should be of one of these forms: =(X,Y),(X, Y), and W(X, Y, Z, ...) For =(X, Y), the code compiles to: if(p.unify(X, Y)) cont For ,(X, Y), the code compiles to compileTerm(Y, compileTerm(X)) (That is, compile X, then use it as the continuation for the compilation of y). For w(X, Y, Z, ...) w = new w(); while(w(X, Y, Z, ...) cont

addConstructor

public void addConstructor(JavaClass cf)
Adds a constructor to the class. The constructor takes a single argument (a Prolog) and stores it in the p field
